title: Contributing to BiocPkgToolsPlus
text: outlines propose change BiocPkgToolsPlus. detailed info contributing , tidyverse packages, please see development contributing guide.

title: Contributing to BiocPkgToolsPlus
text: can fix typos, spelling mistakes, grammatical errors documentation directly using GitHub web interface, long changes made source file. generally means ’ll need edit roxygen2 comments .R, .Rd file. can find .R file generates .Rd reading comment first line.

title: Contributing to BiocPkgToolsPlus
text: want make bigger change, ’s good idea first file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s needed. ’ve found bug, please file issue illustrates bug minimal reprex (also help write unit test, needed).

title: Contributing to BiocPkgToolsPlus
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("kevinrue/BiocPkgToolsPlus", fork = TRUE). Install development dependencies devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md (.e. just first header). Follow style described https://style.tidyverse.org/news.html.

title: Contributing to BiocPkgToolsPlus
text: New code follow tidyverse style guide. can use styler package apply styles, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat unit tests. Contributions test cases included easier accept.

title: Contributing to BiocPkgToolsPlus
text: Please note BiocPkgToolsPlus project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project agree abide terms.

title: Getting help with BiocPkgToolsPlus
text: Thanks using BiocPkgToolsPlus! filing issue, places explore pieces put together make process smooth possible.

title: Getting help with BiocPkgToolsPlus
text: Start making minimal reproducible example using reprex package. haven’t heard used reprex , ’re treat! Seriously, reprex make R-question-asking endeavors easier (pretty insane ROI five ten minutes ’ll take learn ’s ). additional reprex pointers, check Get help! section tidyverse site.

title: Getting help with BiocPkgToolsPlus
text: Armed reprex, next step figure ask. See also Bioconductor help website. ’s question: start community.rstudio.com, /StackOverflow. Bioconductor-related question, please ask Bioconductor Support Website using appropriate package tag (website send automatic email package authors). people answer questions. ’s bug: ’re right place, file issue. ’re sure: let community help figure ! problem bug feature request, can easily return report . opening new issue, sure search issues pull requests make sure bug hasn’t reported /already fixed development version. default, search pre-populated :issue :open. can edit qualifiers (e.g. :pr, :closed) needed. example, ’d simply remove :open search issues repo, open closed.

title: Getting help with BiocPkgToolsPlus
text: efficient possible, development tidyverse packages tends bursty, shouldn’t worry don’t get immediate response. Typically don’t look repo sufficient quantity issues accumulates, ’s burst intense activity focus efforts. makes development efficient avoids expensive context switching problems, cost taking longer get back . process makes good reprex particularly important might multiple months initial report start working . can’t reproduce bug, can’t fix !

title: Introduction to BiocPkgToolsPlus
text: R open-source statistical environment can easily modified enhance functionality via packages. BiocPkgToolsPlus R package available via Bioconductor repository packages. R can installed operating system CRAN can install BiocPkgToolsPlus using following commands R session:
code: if (!requireNamespace("BiocManager", quietly = TRUE)) {       install.packages("BiocManager")   }  BiocManager::install("BiocPkgToolsPlus")  ## Check that you have a valid Bioconductor installation BiocManager::valid()

title: Introduction to BiocPkgToolsPlus
text: BiocPkgToolsPlus based many packages particular implemented infrastructure needed dealing RNA-seq data (EDIT!). , packages like SummarizedExperiment (EDIT!). asking question “start using Bioconductor?” might interested blog post.

title: Introduction to BiocPkgToolsPlus
text: package developers, try explain clearly use packages order use functions. R Bioconductor steep learning curve critical learn ask help. blog post quoted mentions like highlight Bioconductor support site main resource getting help: remember use BiocPkgToolsPlus tag check older posts. alternatives available creating GitHub issues tweeting. However, please note want receive help adhere posting guidelines. particularly critical provide small reproducible example session information package developers can track source error.

title: Introduction to BiocPkgToolsPlus
text: hope BiocPkgToolsPlus useful research. Please use following information cite package overall approach. Thank !
code: ## Citation info citation("BiocPkgToolsPlus") #> To cite package 'BiocPkgToolsPlus' in publications use: #>  #>   kevinrue (2025). _Demonstration of a Bioconductor Package_. #>   doi:10.18129/B9.bioc.BiocPkgToolsPlus #>   <https://doi.org/10.18129/B9.bioc.BiocPkgToolsPlus>, #>   https://github.com/kevinrue/BiocPkgToolsPlus/BiocPkgToolsPlus - R #>   package version 0.99.0, #>   <http://www.bioconductor.org/packages/BiocPkgToolsPlus>. #>  #>   kevinrue (2025). "Demonstration of a Bioconductor Package." #>   _bioRxiv_. doi:10.1101/TODO <https://doi.org/10.1101/TODO>, #>   <https://www.biorxiv.org/content/10.1101/TODO>. #>  #> To see these entries in BibTeX format, use 'print(<citation>, #> bibtex=TRUE)', 'toBibtex(.)', or set #> 'options(citation.bibtex.max=999)'.

title: Introduction to BiocPkgToolsPlus
code: library("BiocPkgToolsPlus")

previous_headings: Quick start to using to BiocPkgToolsPlus > Use cases
what: Getting packages under a biocViews term
title: Introduction to BiocPkgToolsPlus
code: out <- get_packages_by_view("Spatial") #> 'getOption("repos")' replaces Bioconductor standard repositories, see #> 'help("repositories", package = "BiocManager")' for details. #> Replacement repositories: #>     CRAN: https://p3m.dev/cran/__linux__/noble/latest str(out) #>  chr [1:79] "alabaster.sfe" "Banksy" "BatchSVG" "betaHMM" "BulkSignalR" ...

what: Getting packages at the intersection of multiple biocViews terms
title: Introduction to BiocPkgToolsPlus
code: out <- get_packages_by_views(c("Spatial", "SingleCell", "Sequencing")) #> 'getOption("repos")' replaces Bioconductor standard repositories, see #> 'help("repositories", package = "BiocManager")' for details. #> Replacement repositories: #>     CRAN: https://p3m.dev/cran/__linux__/noble/latest str(out) #>  chr [1:13] "DESpace" "knowYourCG" "miRspongeR" "mitology" "poem" ...

previous_headings: Quick start to using to BiocPkgToolsPlus > Use cases
title: Introduction to BiocPkgToolsPlus
text: output can used instantly produce wordcloud choice packages, instance BiocStyle::CRANpkg("wordcloud2"): Note setting size value lower 1 workaround sometimes needed display frequent words, per thread.
code: library("dplyr") out <- get_view_cooccurrences("Spatial") out |> arrange(desc(value)) #> # A tibble: 65 × 2 #>    package            value #>    <chr>              <int> #>  1 Transcriptomics       51 #>  2 SingleCell            49 #>  3 GeneExpression        42 #>  4 DataImport            18 #>  5 RNASeq                15 #>  6 Clustering            14 #>  7 ImmunoOncology        10 #>  8 DataRepresentation     8 #>  9 CellBasedAssays        7 #> 10 QualityControl         7 #> # ℹ 55 more rows library("wordcloud2") wordcloud2(out, minRotation = -pi/2, maxRotation = pi/2, size = 0.5)

previous_headings: Quick start to using to BiocPkgToolsPlus > Use cases
title: Introduction to BiocPkgToolsPlus
text: number packages annotated single biocView term (one children) can obtained follows: output can instantly plotted using BiocStyle::CRANpkg("ggplot2"): Count ‘Spatial’ packages time. get counts multiple biocViews terms, use get_views_counts_over_time(): little bit data wrangling, output can also plotted terms , instance: Count ‘Spatial’ ‘SingleCell’ packages time.
code: out <- get_view_counts_over_time("Spatial") #> 'getOption("repos")' replaces Bioconductor standard repositories, see #> 'help("repositories", package = "BiocManager")' for details. #> Replacement repositories: #>     CRAN: https://p3m.dev/cran/__linux__/noble/latest #> Checking for Bioc Release Update out #> # A tibble: 40 × 2 #>    date       count #>    <date>     <int> #>  1 2006-01-01     0 #>  2 2006-07-01     0 #>  3 2007-01-01     0 #>  4 2007-07-01     0 #>  5 2008-01-01     0 #>  6 2008-07-01     0 #>  7 2009-01-01     0 #>  8 2009-07-01     0 #>  9 2010-01-01     0 #> 10 2010-07-01     0 #> # ℹ 30 more rows library("ggplot2") ggplot(out, aes(date, count)) +   geom_point() +   labs(     title = "Spatial",     y = "Packages",     x = "Time"   ) out <- get_views_counts_over_time(c("Spatial", "SingleCell")) #> 'getOption("repos")' replaces Bioconductor standard repositories, see #> 'help("repositories", package = "BiocManager")' for details. #> Replacement repositories: #>     CRAN: https://p3m.dev/cran/__linux__/noble/latest #> Checking for Bioc Release Update out #> # A tibble: 40 × 3 #>    date       Spatial SingleCell #>    <date>       <int>      <int> #>  1 2006-01-01       0          0 #>  2 2006-07-01       0          0 #>  3 2007-01-01       0          0 #>  4 2007-07-01       0          0 #>  5 2008-01-01       0          0 #>  6 2008-07-01       0          0 #>  7 2009-01-01       0          1 #>  8 2009-07-01       0          1 #>  9 2010-01-01       0          1 #> 10 2010-07-01       0          1 #> # ℹ 30 more rows library("tidyr") library("ggplot2") out|>   pivot_longer(!date) |>   ggplot(aes(date, value, colour = name)) +   geom_point() +   labs(     y = "Packages",     x = "Time",     colour = "biocView"   )

title: Optimisations
text: Attach packages used vignettes.
code: library("BiocPkgTools") #> Loading required package: htmlwidgets library("BiocPkgToolsPlus") #> Loading required package: biocViews

title: Optimisations
text: save typing, get_packages_by_view() calls biocPkgList() internally pkg_list NULL (default). convenient one-calls, slow verbose multiple calls. calling get_packages_by_view() multiple times, efficient call biocPkgList() pass result get_packages_by_view().
code: pkg_list <- biocPkgList() #> 'getOption("repos")' replaces Bioconductor standard repositories, see #> 'help("repositories", package = "BiocManager")' for details. #> Replacement repositories: #>     CRAN: https://p3m.dev/cran/__linux__/noble/latest out1 <- get_packages_by_view("Spatial", pkg_list = pkg_list) out2 <- get_packages_by_view("SingleCell", pkg_list = pkg_list)

title: Optimisations
text: ‘Getting started’ vignette demonstrated single method producing wordcloud. section offers alternatives. Let’s start getting count co-occurrences biocViews term query term, obtained follows: contrast interactive workclouds produced BiocStyle::CRANpkg("wordcloud2"), BiocStyle::CRANpkg("wordcloud") package can used produce static wordclouds, little bit work: Wordcloud.
code: library("dplyr") out <- get_view_cooccurrences(view = "Spatial", pkg_list = pkg_list) out |> arrange(desc(value)) #> # A tibble: 65 × 2 #>    package            value #>    <chr>              <int> #>  1 Transcriptomics       51 #>  2 SingleCell            49 #>  3 GeneExpression        42 #>  4 DataImport            18 #>  5 RNASeq                15 #>  6 Clustering            14 #>  7 ImmunoOncology        10 #>  8 DataRepresentation     8 #>  9 CellBasedAssays        7 #> 10 QualityControl         7 #> # ℹ 55 more rows library(wordcloud) library(RColorBrewer) set.seed(1) wordcloud(   words = out$package,   freq = out$value,   colors = brewer.pal(n = 8, name = "Dark2"),   random.color = TRUE,   rot.per=.2,   scale=c(3, .5) )

title: Analyse the Bioconductor Package Ecosystem
text: goal BiocPkgToolsPlus demonstrate use BiocPkgTools functionality study composition Bioconductor package ecosystem. meant learn packages, identify trends issues package annotations, inform policies package development maintenance.

title: Analyse the Bioconductor Package Ecosystem
text: Get latest stable R release CRAN. install BiocPkgToolsPlus Bioconductor using following code: development version GitHub :
code: if (!requireNamespace("BiocManager", quietly = TRUE)) {     install.packages("BiocManager") }  BiocManager::install("BiocPkgToolsPlus") BiocManager::install("kevinrue/BiocPkgToolsPlus")

title: Analyse the Bioconductor Package Ecosystem
text: basic example shows get names packages annotated given set biocViews.
code: library("BiocPkgToolsPlus") #> Loading required package: biocViews get_packages_by_views(c("Spatial", "Transcriptomics", "SingleCell")) #> 'getOption("repos")' replaces Bioconductor standard repositories, see #> 'help("repositories", package = "BiocManager")' for details. #> Replacement repositories: #>     BioCsoft: https://bioconductor.org/packages/3.21/bioc #>     BioCann: https://bioconductor.org/packages/3.21/data/annotation #>     BioCexp: https://bioconductor.org/packages/3.21/data/experiment #>     BioCworkflows: https://bioconductor.org/packages/3.21/workflows #>     BioCbooks: https://bioconductor.org/packages/3.21/books #>     CRAN: https://packagemanager.posit.co/cran/latest #>  [1] "CARDspa"               "clustSIGNAL"           "concordexR"            #>  [4] "DESpace"               "escheR"                "ggsc"                  #>  [7] "ggspavis"              "hoodscanR"             "nnSVG"                 #> [10] "OSTA.data"             "retrofit"              "SEraster"              #> [13] "smoothclust"           "smoppix"               "SpaceTrooper"          #> [16] "spacexr"               "SpatialExperiment"     "SpatialExperimentIO"   #> [19] "spoon"                 "SpotClean"             "stPipe"                #> [22] "SVP"                   "tidySpatialExperiment" "CatsCradle"            #> [25] "scFeatures"            "SpaceMarkers"

title: Analyse the Bioconductor Package Ecosystem
text: citation output using citation('BiocPkgToolsPlus') R. Please run check updates cite BiocPkgToolsPlus. Please note BiocPkgToolsPlus made possible thanks many R bioinformatics software authors, cited either vignettes /paper(s) describing package.
code: print(citation('BiocPkgToolsPlus'), bibtex = TRUE) #> To cite package 'BiocPkgToolsPlus' in publications use: #>  #>   kevinrue (2025). _Demonstration of a Bioconductor Package_. #>   doi:10.18129/B9.bioc.BiocPkgToolsPlus #>   <https://doi.org/10.18129/B9.bioc.BiocPkgToolsPlus>, #>   https://github.com/kevinrue/BiocPkgToolsPlus/BiocPkgToolsPlus - R #>   package version 0.99.0, #>   <http://www.bioconductor.org/packages/BiocPkgToolsPlus>. #>  #> A BibTeX entry for LaTeX users is #>  #>   @Manual{, #>     title = {Demonstration of a Bioconductor Package}, #>     author = {{kevinrue}}, #>     year = {2025}, #>     url = {http://www.bioconductor.org/packages/BiocPkgToolsPlus}, #>     note = {https://github.com/kevinrue/BiocPkgToolsPlus/BiocPkgToolsPlus - R package version 0.99.0}, #>     doi = {10.18129/B9.bioc.BiocPkgToolsPlus}, #>   } #>  #>   kevinrue (2025). "Demonstration of a Bioconductor Package." #>   _bioRxiv_. doi:10.1101/TODO <https://doi.org/10.1101/TODO>, #>   <https://www.biorxiv.org/content/10.1101/TODO>. #>  #> A BibTeX entry for LaTeX users is #>  #>   @Article{, #>     title = {Demonstration of a Bioconductor Package}, #>     author = {{kevinrue}}, #>     year = {2025}, #>     journal = {bioRxiv}, #>     doi = {10.1101/TODO}, #>     url = {https://www.biorxiv.org/content/10.1101/TODO}, #>   }

title: Analyse the Bioconductor Package Ecosystem
text: Please note BiocPkgToolsPlus project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project, agree abide terms.

title: Analyse the Bioconductor Package Ecosystem
text: Continuous code testing possible thanks GitHub actions usethis, remotes, rcmdcheck customized use Bioconductor’s docker containers BiocCheck. Code coverage assessment possible thanks codecov covr. documentation website automatically updated thanks pkgdown. code styled automatically thanks styler. documentation formatted thanks devtools roxygen2. details, check dev directory. package developed using biocthis.

title: Analyse the Bioconductor Package Ecosystem
text: Please note BiocPkgToolsPlus project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project, agree abide terms.

title: Get Packages by biocViews — get_packages_by_view
text: get_packages_by_view() returns package names associated single biocViews term. get_packages_by_views() returns packages names intersection multiple biocViews terms.

title: Get Packages by biocViews — get_packages_by_view
code: get_packages_by_view(view, pkg_list = NULL)  get_packages_by_views(views, pkg_list = NULL)

title: Get Packages by biocViews — get_packages_by_view
text: view single biocView term. pkg_list Value call biocPkgList(). NULL (default), call biocPkgList() internally. See Details. views character vector biocView terms.

title: Get Packages by biocViews — get_packages_by_view
text: Character vector package names.

title: Get Packages by biocViews — get_packages_by_view
text: Calling BiocPkgTools::biocPkgList() passing result get_packages_by_view() get_packages_by_views() efficient making multiple calls. See vignette 'Optimisations' comprehensive discussion demonstration.

title: Get Packages by biocViews — get_packages_by_view
code: get_packages_by_view("Spatial") #> 'getOption("repos")' replaces Bioconductor standard repositories, see #> 'help("repositories", package = "BiocManager")' for details. #> Replacement repositories: #>     CRAN: https://p3m.dev/cran/__linux__/noble/latest #>  [1] "alabaster.sfe"            "Banksy"                   #>  [3] "BatchSVG"                 "betaHMM"                  #>  [5] "BulkSignalR"              "CARDspa"                  #>  [7] "CatsCradle"               "clustSIGNAL"              #>  [9] "concordexR"               "CTSV"                     #> [11] "cytoviewer"               "DESpace"                  #> [13] "escheR"                   "FuseSOM"                  #> [15] "GeomxTools"               "ggsc"                     #> [17] "ggspavis"                 "HiCPotts"                 #> [19] "hoodscanR"                "HuBMAPR"                  #> [21] "imcRtools"                "jazzPanda"                #> [23] "knowYourCG"               "lisaClust"                #> [25] "miRspongeR"               "mistyR"                   #> [27] "mitology"                 "MoleculeExperiment"       #> [29] "nnSVG"                    "OSTA.data"                #> [31] "pengls"                   "poem"                     #> [33] "RegionalST"               "retrofit"                 #> [35] "scatterHatch"             "sccomp"                   #> [37] "scDesign3"                "scider"                   #> [39] "SEraster"                 "shinyDSP"                 #> [41] "signifinder"              "simpleSeg"                #> [43] "smoothclust"              "smoppix"                  #> [45] "sosta"                    "SpaceMarkers"             #> [47] "SpaceTrooper"             "spacexr"                  #> [49] "SpaNorm"                  "spARI"                    #> [51] "spaSim"                   "SpatialDecon"             #> [53] "SpatialExperiment"        "SpatialExperimentIO"      #> [55] "spatialFDA"               "SpatialFeatureExperiment" #> [57] "SpatialOmicsOverlay"      "spatialSimGP"             #> [59] "SPIAT"                    "spicyR"                   #> [61] "spoon"                    "SpotClean"                #> [63] "SPOTlight"                "SpotSweeper"              #> [65] "standR"                   "Statial"                  #> [67] "stJoincount"              "stPipe"                   #> [69] "SVP"                      "tidySpatialExperiment"    #> [71] "tomoda"                   "tomoseqr"                 #> [73] "tpSVG"                    "VisiumIO"                 #> [75] "visiumStitched"           "Voyager"                  #> [77] "XeniumIO"                 "scFeatures"               #> [79] "spatialHeatmap"           get_packages_by_views(c("Spatial", "SingleCell")) https://p3m.dev/cran/__linux__/noble/latest #>  [1] "Banksy"                "CARDspa"               "CatsCradle"            #>  [4] "clustSIGNAL"           "concordexR"            "cytoviewer" "imcRtools"             "knowYourCG"            #> [16] "lisaClust"             "miRspongeR"            "mistyR"                #> [19] "mitology"              "nnSVG"                 "OSTA.data" "simpleSeg"             "smoothclust"           #> [31] "smoppix"               "SpaceMarkers"          "SpaceTrooper"          #> [34] "spacexr"               "SpatialExperiment" title: Measure Package Similarity — get_similar_packages
text: Measure Package Similarity

title: Measure Package Similarity — get_similar_packages
code: get_similar_packages(pkg, pkg_list = NULL)

title: Measure Package Similarity — get_similar_packages
text: pkg single package name. pkg_list Value call biocPkgList(). NULL (default), call biocPkgList() internally. See Details.

title: Measure Package Similarity — get_similar_packages
text: tibble two columns: package similarity. package name every package. similarity measure similarity (see Details).

title: Measure Package Similarity — get_similar_packages
text: Calling BiocPkgTools::biocPkgList() passing result get_packages_by_view() get_packages_by_views() efficient making multiple calls. See vignette 'Optimisations' comprehensive discussion demonstration. Currently, similarity quantified taking Hamming distance set biocViews used tag least one package, dividing number biocViews normalise within range [0, 1], finally taking one minus value yield measure similarity range [0, 1].

title: Measure Package Similarity — get_similar_packages
code: get_similar_packages("edgeR") #> 'getOption("repos")' replaces Bioconductor standard repositories, see #> 'help("repositories", package = "BiocManager")' for details. #> Replacement repositories: #>     CRAN: https://p3m.dev/cran/__linux__/noble/latest #> # A tibble: 2,360 × 2 #>    package           similarity #>    <chr>                  <dbl> #>  1 metaseqR2              0.908 #>  2 dearseq                0.883 #>  3 limma                  0.883 #>  4 dreamlet               0.877 #>  5 roastgsa               0.877 #>  6 crumblr                0.871 #>  7 variancePartition      0.871 #>  8 zenith                 0.871 #>  9 BASiCS                 0.865 #> 10 BASiCStan              0.865 #> # ℹ 2,350 more rows

title: Get biocViews Co-Occurrence Counts — get_view_cooccurrences
text: Get biocViews Co-Occurrence Counts

title: Get biocViews Co-Occurrence Counts — get_view_cooccurrences
code: get_view_cooccurrences(view, pkg_list = NULL, keep_self = FALSE, ratio = FALSE)

title: Get biocViews Co-Occurrence Counts — get_view_cooccurrences
text: view biocViews term. pkg_list Value call biocPkgList(). NULL (default), call biocPkgList() internally. See Details. keep_self Logical. Include view output. ratio Logical. Return fraction packages annotated view also annotated term, rather raw counts.

title: Get biocViews Co-Occurrence Counts — get_view_cooccurrences
text: tibble two columns: date cooccurences. package biocViews term. value number (fraction, ratio = TRUE) packages associated view package.

title: Get biocViews Co-Occurrence Counts — get_view_cooccurrences
text: Calling BiocPkgTools::biocPkgList() passing result get_packages_by_view() get_packages_by_views() efficient making multiple calls. See vignette 'Optimisations' comprehensive discussion demonstration.

title: Get biocViews Co-Occurrence Counts — get_view_cooccurrences
code: library(dplyr) #>  #> Attaching package: ‘dplyr’ #> The following objects are masked from ‘package:stats’: #>  #>     filter, lag #> The following objects are masked from ‘package:base’: #>  #>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union get_view_cooccurrences("Spatial") |>   arrange(desc(value)) #> 'getOption("repos")' replaces Bioconductor standard repositories, see #> 'help("repositories", package = "BiocManager")' for details. #> Replacement repositories: #>     CRAN: https://p3m.dev/cran/__linux__/noble/latest #> # A tibble: 65 × 2 #>    package            value #>    <chr>              <int> #>  1 Transcriptomics       51 #>  2 SingleCell            49 #>  3 GeneExpression        42 #>  4 DataImport            18 #>  5 RNASeq                15 #>  6 Clustering            14 #>  7 ImmunoOncology        10 #>  8 DataRepresentation     8 #>  9 CellBasedAssays        7 #> 10 QualityControl         7 #> # ℹ 55 more rows

title: biocViews Counts Over Time — get_view_counts_over_time
text: biocViews Counts Time

title: biocViews Counts Over Time — get_view_counts_over_time
code: get_view_counts_over_time(view, pkg_list = NULL, pkg_years = NULL)  get_views_counts_over_time(views, pkg_list = NULL, pkg_years = NULL)

title: biocViews Counts Over Time — get_view_counts_over_time
text: view single biocView term. pkg_list Value call biocPkgList(). NULL (default), call biocPkgList() internally. See Details. pkg_years Value call getPkgYearsInBioc(). NULL (default), call getPkgYearsInBioc() internally. views character vector biocView terms.

title: biocViews Counts Over Time — get_view_counts_over_time
text: get_view_counts_over_time(), tibble two columns: date count. date sequence dates spaced six months 2006 current year. count number packages associated view (one child terms). get_views_counts_over_time(), tibble $N+1$ columns: one column date one column view views.

title: biocViews Counts Over Time — get_view_counts_over_time
text: Calling BiocPkgTools::biocPkgList() passing result get_packages_by_view() get_packages_by_views() efficient making multiple calls. See vignette 'Optimisations' comprehensive discussion demonstration.

title: biocViews Counts Over Time — get_view_counts_over_time
code: get_view_counts_over_time("SingleCell") #> 'getOption("repos")' replaces Bioconductor standard repositories, see #> 'help("repositories", package = "BiocManager")' for details. #> Replacement repositories: #>     CRAN: https://p3m.dev/cran/__linux__/noble/latest #> Checking for Bioc Release Update #> # A tibble: 40 × 2 #>    date       count #>    <date>     <int> #>  1 2006-01-01     0 #>  2 2006-07-01     0 #>  3 2007-01-01     0 #>  4 2007-07-01     0 #>  5 2008-01-01     0 #>  6 2008-07-01     0 #>  7 2009-01-01     1 #>  8 2009-07-01     1 #>  9 2010-01-01     1 #> 10 2010-07-01     1 #> # ℹ 30 more rows get_views_counts_over_time(c("Spatial", "SingleCell")) #> 'getOption("repos")' replaces Bioconductor standard repositories, see #> 'help("repositories", package = "BiocManager")' for details. #> Replacement repositories: #>     CRAN: https://p3m.dev/cran/__linux__/noble/latest #> Checking for Bioc Release Update #> # A tibble: 40 × 3 #>    date       Spatial SingleCell #>    <date>       <int>      <int> #>  1 2006-01-01       0          0 #>  2 2006-07-01       0          0 #>  3 2007-01-01       0          0 #>  4 2007-07-01       0          0 #>  5 2008-01-01       0          0 #>  6 2008-07-01       0          0 #>  7 2009-01-01       0          1 #>  8 2009-07-01       0          1 #>  9 2010-01-01       0          1 #> 10 2010-07-01       0          1 #> # ℹ 30 more rows

text: logical matrix indicating packages associated biocViews term (one child terms).

title: Package-by-biocView Membership Matrix — get_view_membership_matrix
text: Calling BiocPkgTools::biocPkgList() passing result get_packages_by_view() get_packages_by_views() efficient making multiple calls. See vignette 'Optimisations' comprehensive discussion demonstration.

title: Package-by-biocView Membership Matrix — get_view_membership_matrix
code: out <- get_view_membership_matrix() #> 'getOption("repos")' replaces Bioconductor standard repositories, see #> 'help("repositories", package = "BiocManager")' for details. #> Replacement repositories: #>     CRAN: https://p3m.dev/cran/__linux__/noble/latest out[1:5, 1:5] #>           BiocViews Software AnnotationData ExperimentData Workflow #> a4             TRUE     TRUE          FALSE          FALSE    FALSE #> a4Base         TRUE     TRUE          FALSE          FALSE    FALSE #> a4Classif      TRUE     TRUE          FALSE          FALSE    FALSE #> a4Core         TRUE     TRUE          FALSE          FALSE    FALSE #> a4Preproc      TRUE     TRUE          FALSE          FALSE    FALSE
